definition: Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
person from Shandong/often refers to Confucius

sentences.english: The King of Lu led the army by himself.
sentences.chinese: 鲁国由鲁王亲自带兵迎战。

sentences.english: Confucius was a well-known teacher in the Lu Kingdom 2000 years ago.

sentences.chinese: 这回又有一些鲁国学者求见。

sentences.chinese: 春秋时期鲁国与列国的盟誓有不同的特征。

sentences.chinese: 于是齐国军队认为鲁国胆小不敢进攻，便懈怠下来。

sentences.chinese: 当他路过鲁国时，鲁国有些学者想登门求见。

sentences.chinese: 当他路过鲁国时，鲁国有些学者想登门求见。

sentences.chinese: 孔子登上东山往下看，便觉得鲁国小了。

sentences.english: King Wu was very pleased. He accepted the rare gift and rewarded the ambassador generously.

definition: Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the lord of Lu (who declined to employ Confucius)
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the state of Ju, ancient Dongyi state
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Duke Xiang of Song (reigned 650-637 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Yanzi (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States, also known as 晏子, hero of book 晏子春秋
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
to defend one's country
state of Wei (c. 1040-209 BC), vassal of Zhou

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
